alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 7:53AM EST until January 02 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Clinch River Near Richlands affecting Tazewell County. .From 1 to 3 inches of rain fell across the upper Clinch River basin during the past 24 to 36 hours. This has resulted in excessive runoff into area creeks, streams, and rivers. Minor flooding is occurring along the Clinch River at Richlands and minor flooding is expected to continue through this afternoon along the Clinch River at Richlands and downstream. For the Clinch River...including Richlands...Minor flooding is occurring. Minor flooding is forecast to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clinch River Near Richlands. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon or early evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water begins to flood baseball field near water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 10.5 feet and very slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest late this morning or early this afternoon around 10.6 to 10.7 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Location Stg Stg Day/Time Clinch River Richlands 10.0 10.5 Sun 7 am EST &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by early this afternoon.
